page.title: 09HORSES
page.content: One farm in the area breeds{shire {horses.}They are shown all over this country and many are sold abroad. They will be going to the{Great Yorkshire {Show.}Another farm specialises in breeding{Welsh Mountain ponies.}They are shown all over the country and have won many prizes, trophies and rosettes. The average day for the stable girls begin at 7.00 a.m. Horses are brought in at night. The girls feed them and then let them out if it is summer. The stables then have to be cleaned out and fresh straw put down. The horses are then trained or broken if they are young. Also on the farm are large horses that are used for riding to the Hunt. One is an{arab {stallion.}The farm grows grass for hay which is fed to the horses with barley, oats and sugar beet.
